sources.data_found: The Afton and Rivanna systems provide access to 55 nodes with NVIDIA general purpose GPU accelerators (RTX2080, RTX3090, A6000, V100, A40, A100, and H200), including an NVIDIA BasePOD.
The Rivanna and Afton systems provide access to 55 nodes with NVIDIA general purpose GPU accelerators (RTX2080, RTX3090, A6000, V100, A40, A100, and H200), including an NVIDIA BasePOD.
This includes an 18-node DGX BasePOD system with 8x A100 GPU devices per node, as well as newly added HGX H200 GPU nodes.

The UVA Department of Computer Science is a nationally recognized leader in computer science research and education. Our department includes over 60 faculty members, over 200 graduate students and 1400 undergraduates.

The POD nodes are contained in the gpu partition with a specific Slurm constraint. Multi-node jobs on the POD should request all GPUs on the nodes, i.e. --gres=gpu:a100:8. You may have already used the POD by simply requesting an A100 node without the constraint, since 18 out of the total 20 A100 nodes are POD nodes.

gpu_resources.notes: CALCULATIONS: BasePOD has 18 nodes × 8 A100 80GB/node = 144 A100 80GB. Additional 2 A100 nodes exist (20 total - 18 BasePOD = 2 regular A100 nodes). These 2 regular nodes likely have 40GB A100s based on standard configurations, at 8 GPUs/node = 16 A100 40GB. H200 nodes are mentioned but exact count not found. A40, A6000, V100, RTX3090, RTX2080 are all available but specific counts not provided. Total of 55 GPU nodes including all types.

analysis_notes: UVA has substantial GPU resources centered around an 18-node NVIDIA DGX BasePOD with 144 A100 80GB GPUs, plus additional A100 40GB, H200, and other GPU types across 55 total GPU nodes. The CS department serves 1,400 undergraduates and 200+ graduate students.
